docs.title: Welcome!
docs.text: warrior-bot is a CLI tool for Wayne State University staff and students. The idea is to make many of the things we need day to day easier to access and use through the terminal.

docs.title: Quick Start
docs.text:
Install warrior-bot:

pip install warrior-bot

This will not work yet, as we have not published anything on the package index thus far. To install, clone the repo and run pip install -e .

Use the CLI:

"wb" is a shorthand alias for "warrior-bot" 

# Find information
wb where naresh mahabir

# Navigate to resources
wb go degree works

# Booking rooms
wb book --b state hall

docs.title: Next Steps
docs.text:
• Installation Guide
  • Quick Start Tutorial
  • Command Reference

docs.title: License
docs.text: This project is dual-licensed under MIT or Apache 2.0 - choose whichever works best for you.

docs.title: Commands Overview
docs.text: warrior-bot provides three main commands to help you access WSU resources quickly.

docs.title: go
docs.text:
Navigate to WSU resources and websites.

Learn more →

docs.title: where
docs.text:
Find people, places, or information about WSU locations.

Learn more →

docs.title: book
docs.text:
Reserve spaces and facilities at WSU.

Learn more →

docs.title: Usage Pattern
docs.text:
All commands follow a consistent pattern:

wb <command> [options] [arguments]

Use --help with any command to see available options:

wb <command> --help

docs.title: book command
docs.text: Reserve spaces and facilities at Wayne State University.

docs.title: Usage
docs.text: wb book [options]

docs.title: Examples
docs.text:
# Book a room in State Hall
wb book --b state hall

# Book a study room
wb book --room study

# View available spaces
wb book --list

docs.title: Options
docs.text:
• --b, --building: Specify the building name
  • --room: Specify room type or number
  • --list: List available spaces

Use --help to see all available options:

wb book --help

docs.title: Bookable Resources
docs.text:
Common resources you can book:

  • Study rooms
  • Computer labs
  • Meeting spaces
  • Conference rooms

docs.title: go command
docs.text: Navigate to WSU resources and websites quickly.

docs.title: Usage
docs.text: wb go <destination>

docs.title: Examples
docs.text:
# Access degree tracking
wb go degree works

# Open student registration services
wb go register

# View class schedule
wb go schedule

docs.title: Available Destinations
docs.text: Coming soon - this command is currently in development.

docs.title: Options
docs.text:
Use --help to see all available options:

wb go --help

docs.title: where command
docs.text: Find people, places, or information about WSU locations.

docs.title: Usage
docs.text: wb where <query>

docs.title: Examples
docs.text:
# Find a person
wb where naresh mahabir

# Find a building
wb where state hall

# Find a department
wb where computer science

docs.title: Search Types
docs.text:
The where command can help you find:

  • People: Faculty, staff, and students
  • Places: Buildings, rooms, and facilities
  • Departments: Academic and administrative units

docs.title: Options
docs.text:
Use --help to see all available options:

wb where --help

docs.title: Architecture
docs.text:
warrior-bot is designed with a modular architecture that makes it easy to add new commands.

AI Disclosure Notice: This document was generated using Claude Opus 4.5, and finely edited by a human.

docs.title: Project Structure
docs.text:
warrior-bot/
├── warrior_bot/           # Main package
│   ├── __init__.py       # Package initialization
│   ├── __main__.py       # Entry point for python -m
│   ├── cli.py            # CLI setup and command registration
│   └── commands/         # All commands
│       ├── go/          
│       │   └── __init__.py
│       ├── where/
│       │   └── __init__.py
│       └── book/
│           └── __init__.py
├── docs/                 # Documentation
├── tests/               # Tests (coming soon)
├── setup.py            # Package setup
├── mkdocs.yml          # Documentation config
└── requirements.txt    # Dependencies

docs.title: Command Architecture
docs.text:
Each command lives in its own folder under warrior_bot/commands/. This provides:

  • Isolation: Each command is self-contained
  • Scalability: Easy to add complexity without affecting other commands
  • Clarity: Clear separation of concerns

docs.title: Command Structure
docs.text:
Each command is a Click command function:

import click

@click.command()
@click.option('--flag', is_flag=True, help='Example flag')
@click.argument('arg')
def mycommand(flag, arg):
    """Command description."""
    click.echo(f"Running with arg: {arg}")

docs.title: Command Registration
docs.text:
Commands are registered in cli.py:

import click
from warrior_bot.commands import go, where, book

@click.group()
def cli():
    """Warrior Bot CLI."""
    pass

cli.add_command(go.go)
cli.add_command(where.where)
cli.add_command(book.book)

docs.title: Design Principles
docs.text:
1. Keep it simple: Commands should be straightforward to use
  2. Modular design: Each command is independent
  3. Consistent UX: All commands follow similar patterns
  4. Extensible: Easy to add new commands and features

docs.title: Technology Stack
docs.text:
• Click: CLI framework
  • Python 3.10+: Language and runtime
  • MkDocs Material: Documentation
  • GitHub Actions: CI/CD

docs.title: Contributing
docs.text: Thank you for your interest in contributing to warrior-bot!

docs.title: Development Setup
docs.text:
1. Clone the repository:
git clone https://github.com/yourusername/warrior-bot.git
cd warrior-bot
  1. Create a virtual environment:
python3 -m venv venv
source venv/bin/activate  # On Windows: venv\Scripts\activate
  1. Install development dependencies:
pip install -r requirements-dev.txt
pip install -e .
  1. Set up pre-commit hooks:
pre-commit install

docs.title: Code Standards
docs.text:
We use several tools to maintain code quality:

  • black: Code formatting
  • isort: Import sorting
  • flake8: Linting
  • mypy: Type checking

Run all checks:

black warrior_bot/
isort warrior_bot/
flake8 warrior_bot/
mypy warrior_bot/

Or let pre-commit handle it automatically when you commit.

docs.title: Adding a New Command
docs.text:
1. Create a new folder in warrior_bot/commands/:
mkdir warrior_bot/commands/mycommand
  1. Create __init__.py with your command:
"""My command implementation."""

import click


@click.command()
def mycommand():
    """My command description."""
    click.echo("Hello from mycommand!")
  1. Register it in warrior_bot/cli.py:
from warrior_bot.commands import mycommand

# In the cli function:
cli.add_command(mycommand.mycommand)

docs.title: Documentation
docs.text:
Update the docs when adding features:

  1. Edit files in the docs/ directory
  2. Preview locally:
mkdocs serve
  1. Visit http://127.0.0.1:8000 to see your changes

docs.title: Submitting Changes
docs.text:
1. Create a new branch:
git checkout -b feature/my-feature
  1. Make your changes and commit:
git add .
git commit -m "Add my feature"
  1. Push and create a pull request:
git push origin feature/my-feature

docs.title: Questions?
docs.text: Feel free to open an issue if you have questions!

docs.title: Requirements
docs.text:
• Python 3.10+
  • pip, poetry or uv

docs.title: Install from PyPI
docs.text:
pip install warrior-bot

This will not work yet, as we have not published anything on the package index yet. To install, clone the repo and run pip install -e .

docs.title: Install from Source
docs.text:
Clone the repository:

git clone https://github.com/yourusername/warrior-bot.git
cd warrior-bot

Install in development mode:

pip install -e .

docs.title: Verify Installation
docs.text:
Check that the installation worked:

wb --help

You should see the warrior-bot help message.

docs.title: Terminal Recommendations
docs.text:
For the best experience, we recommend using a modern terminal emulator:

  • Ghostty
  • Alacritty
  • Kitty
  • WezTerm

On macOS, iTerm2 is the defacto standard.

docs.title: Quick Start
docs.text: This guide will get you up and running with warrior-bot in minutes.

docs.title: Basic Usage
docs.text: warrior-bot (or wb for short) provides several commands to help you navigate WSU resources.

docs.title: Finding People or Places
docs.text:
Use the where command to find people or locations:

wb where naresh mahabir

docs.title: Navigating to Resources
docs.text:
Use the go command to quickly access WSU resources:

wb go degree works

docs.title: Booking Facilities
docs.text:
Use the book command to reserve spaces:

wb book --b state hall

docs.title: Command Aliases
docs.text:
You can use either the full command name or the short alias:

  • warrior-bot or wb

Both work exactly the same way!

docs.title: Getting Help
docs.text:
For any command, you can add --help to see available options:

wb --help
wb go --help
wb where --help
wb book --help

docs.title: Next Steps
docs.text:
• Learn more about each command
  • Check out the development guide if you want to contribute
